intro: Allamanda linnaei, commonly known as the yellow allamanda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves that are opposite and ovate in shape. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Allamanda linnaei is also known for its ability to produce a milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested.
